result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon E Hurckman

records.addlTxt:
2:18 PM Defendant Shannon E Hurckman appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Shannon E Hurckman.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
21CF179 & 22CF98 tracking together:
Atty Gumz asks for another status as the defendant is getting an assessment done; heading towards a waiver of Prelim.  

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:47 AM Defendant Shannon E Hurckman appeared by phone.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Shannon E Hurckman.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
21CF179 tracking with 22CF98:
Atty Gumz states that there is an offer on just the one case but wants to see about a global offer.

22CF98:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Set status on both cases
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

3:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon E Hurckman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Allison Markoski appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 
Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  
Atty Markoski makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $200 Cash bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.
